title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Dolphins are dealing with internal challenges after a 33-8 loss to the Colts led to a players-only meeting.
Tua Tagovailoa is undefeated in seven career starts against the Patriots, with a completion rate of 69%.
Dolphins' defensive front features pass rushers like Bradley Chubb and Zach Sieler, despite a weakened secondary.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed at Roadrunner in Boston on September 12, 2025, with a Southern Gothic theme.
The concert featured songs from 'Willoughby Tucker, I'll Always Love You' and included a collaboration with Jae Matthews.
Cain's setlist included 'Willoughby’s Theme,' 'Dust Bowl,' and 'American Teenager,' ending with a shared moment with the audience.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars as Mike Flynt in 'The Senior,' a film based on a true story of college football redemption.
Chiklis returned to tackle football for the film, portraying a 59-year-old who rejoined a college team decades after being expelled.
The film, co-starring Rob Corddry and Mary Stuart Masterson, premieres nationally on September 19 after a Boston screening.

title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Forbes' list of the 400 richest Americans includes nine Massachusetts residents, with Abigail Johnson as the state's wealthiest.
Abigail Johnson ranks 27th with a net worth of $35 billion, leading the state in wealth, followed by Edward Johnson IV.
Robert Kraft, owner of the Patriots, ranks 78th nationally, with a net worth of $13.8 billion from sports and other ventures.

title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Red Sox lost 4-1 to the Yankees in a crucial series opener at Fenway Park on Friday.
Boston's offense struggled, managing only two hits and going 0-for-8 with runners in scoring position.
The Red Sox committed three errors, contributing to their defeat and missing opportunities to secure a win.

title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Deatrich Wise Jr., now with the Washington Commanders, suffered a season-ending quad injury against the Green Bay Packers.
Wise, 31, incurred the injury during an extra point attempt and will require surgery, ending his 2025 season.
Wise signed a one-year, $3.25 million contract with the Commanders in March after eight seasons with the Patriots.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early is a candidate to start Tuesday's game against the Athletics, pending a decision on Sunday.
Early impressed in his MLB debut, striking out 11 batters in five scoreless innings against the Athletics.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora is considering pitching options, including Payton Tolle and Kyle Harrison, amidst rotation changes.

title: Scott Boras says he, Alex Bregman are ‘waiting until the offseason’ before making opt-out decision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman and agent Scott Boras will decide on his opt-out after the current MLB season ends.
Bregman signed a three-year, $120 million contract with the Red Sox; it includes an opt-out after 2025 and 2026.
Bregman's impact on the Red Sox includes mentoring younger players, despite a mid-season injury affecting his performance.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Only Murders in the Building' Season 5 with Steve Martin, Martin Short, and Selena Gomez is streaming on Hulu.
'Misery', directed by Rob Reiner and starring Kathy Bates, is available to stream on HBO Max.
'The Girlfriend', a psychological thriller starring Robin Wright and Olivia Cooke, is streaming on Prime Video.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez, Keion White ruled out vs. Dolphins
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Cornerback Christian Gonzalez and defensive end Keion White are ruled out for the Patriots' game against the Dolphins.
Christian Gonzalez has been sidelined since July 28 due to a hamstring injury and missed Week 1 against the Raiders.
Linebacker Marte Mapu and offensive tackle Morgan Moses are listed as questionable for the Patriots' upcoming matchup.
